jobs.title: Care Advocate
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Who we are:

Oma is a network of clinics opening throughout the US, comprise an innovative CA based fertility clinic start-up. Our mission is to empower growing families with science forward, affordable fertility treatment that set a new standard in IVF success rates. We believe in a world in which everyone seeking to have a child can successfully access the most advanced fertility treatments.

 

Position Summary: 

The Remote IVF Care Coordinator provides highly personalized care to leads and patients, ensuring their experience at OMA is smooth from the beginning to the end. This position interacts directly with leads, patients, providers, clinical staff, financial team, and management. The Care Advocate reports to the Customer Success Manager.

Responsibilities may include:

●        Manage leads across all marketing platforms, with ability to assess the needs of leads and present information on fertility services and financials available at OMA. Explain an often difficult and confusing process in a digestible manner.

●        Respond to lead and established patient inquiries, assisting  them with their questions, scheduling appointments, taking payments.

●        Review all new patient appointments daily and reach out to patients post visit. Provide guidance and walk them through their fertility journey at OMA. Be a liaison between the patients and clinical teams.

●        Lead meetings (daily/weekly/as needed). Collaborate with sales, finance, clinical, and management to  develop processes to alleviate pain points of the patient journey. Implement changes to improve patient acquisition/retention.

●        Track conversions along the marketing funnel: Inquiries, Inquiries to Scheduled Appointments, Testing to Follow-up Visits, Follow-up Visits to Treatment, Patient/Treatment Retention, Refund Requests.

●        Generate weekly and monthly reports of new leads, referrals, marketing efforts, and procedures.

●        Financial Coverage: Train on the financial process and provide backup coverage to the Financial Care Coordinator. Be able to provide patients with financial information, educating them on estimates for treatment and medications, insurance coverage/reimbursement and financial assistance with external  parties such as CapexMD. Collect payment information and communicate with the clinical team that patients are cleared to start treatment.

●        Egg Donation Program Coverage: Train on the egg donor process and provide backup coverage to the Third-Party Coordinator when needed. Be able to conduct pre-screening of potential donor and correspond with them, track the application and donation process and be the liaison between the  donors and clinical staff.

 

Minimum Qualifications:

●        Experience in the fertility or medical field. The candidate must possess a basic understanding of reproductive health.

 

Competencies:

●        Excellent computer knowledge, including proficiency in Word and Excel. Ability to learn Electronic Medical Records and any new applications needed for the position.

●        Empathic and motivated to help patients. Strong interpersonal and problem-solving skills and be able to deal with intricate and sensitive subjects.

●        Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

●        Excellent teamwork and networking skills.

●        Strong organizational and time management skills. Works well independently.

 

Physical Demands and Work Environment:

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit, use hands and fingers to handle or feel, as well as talk and hear. The employee is regularly required to reach with hands and arms. The employee is required to stand and walk. The employee may lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions

To find out more: If you have this experience, are curious and intrigued but would like to learn more, please send your Linked-In profile or a brief overview of your experience and let’s schedule a 30-minute chat.

Our Company is an equal opportunity employer. Employment and processes, including decisions to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, are based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

Our Company requires those hired into this position to provide proof that they have received the COVID-19 vaccine. Any individuals subject to this requirement may submit for consideration a request to be exempted from the requirement (based on a valid religious or medical reason) on forms to be provided by Our Company. Such requests will be subject to review and approval by Our Company, and exemptions will be granted only if Our Company can provide a reasonable accommodation in relation to the requested exemption. Note that approvals for reasonable accommodations are reviewed and approved on a case-by-case basis and availability of a reasonable accommodation is not guaranteed. This vaccination requirement is based, in part, on recently established government requirements. The requirement is also based on the safety and effectiveness of the vaccine in protecting against COVID-19, and our shared responsibility for the health and safety of patients, colleagues, and community. Employment is also contingent upon successful completion of a background check.

jobs.title: 3rd Party Coordinator
jobs.descriptionHtml:
The 3rd Party Coordinator is responsible for facilitating and optimizing the donor program at Oma Fertility. Serve as a representative of Oma Fertility to 3rd party entities as it relates to the donor program

 

Essential Functions

● Review profiles and conduct pre-screening assessments with donors, ensuring a positive experience

● Explain the process in a digestible manner to donors, giving a general overview of guidelines and expectations

● Obtain required applications, consents, contracts needed for donors and surrogates. Review documents for completeness and conduct follow ups as needed

● Communicate and provide support for donors, clinical and outside agency teams to expedite the approval process

● Aid in the coordination of testing and screening appointments, providing support to clinical staff

● Manage the Oma Fertility’s online donor platform and maintain a detailed database, tracking the donor pre-screening process and outcome

● Works closely with management to ensure success of egg donor recruitment, recognizing opportunities for increased efficiency and makes recommendations

● Ensure compliance of industry standards, policies, and practices, and assist with regulatory audits when needed

● Learn, follow, and keep up to date with FDA regulations for HCT/Ps and ASRM guidelines related to Third Party Reproduction

● Handle all interactions and information with privacy and discretion. Ensuring information is kept strictly confidential is critical to this role and for the safety of our patients and donors

 

Desired Skills/Qualifications

● Experience in the fertility or medical field, specifically with 3rd party reproduction

● Independent, creative thinker, requiring minimal supervision as expected of remote positions

● The candidate must have strong interpersonal and problem-solving skills and be able to deal with intricate and sensitive subjects

● Excellent computer knowledge, including proficiency in Word and Excel. Ability to learn Electronic Medical Records and any new applications needed for the position

● Bachelor's degree in public health, health administration, or related field

To find out more: If you have this experience, are curious and intrigued but would like to learn more, please send your Linked-In profile or a brief overview of your experience and let’s schedule a 30-minute chat.

Our Company is an equal opportunity employer. Employment and processes, including decisions to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, are based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

Our Company requires those hired into this position to provide proof that they have received the COVID-19 vaccine. Any individuals subject to this requirement may submit for consideration a request to be exempted from the requirement (based on a valid religious or medical reason) on forms to be provided by Our Company. Such requests will be subject to review and approval by Our Company, and exemptions will be granted only if Our Company can provide a reasonable accommodation in relation to the requested exemption. Note that approvals for reasonable accommodations are reviewed and approved on a case-by-case basis and availability of a reasonable accommodation is not guaranteed. This vaccination requirement is based, in part, on recently established government requirements. The requirement is also based on the safety and effectiveness of the vaccine in protecting against COVID-19, and our shared responsibility for the health and safety of patients, colleagues, and community. Employment is also contingent upon successful completion of a background check.

jobs.title: Customer Success Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Oma is a network of fertility clinics located across the United States that provides medical, financial, and emotional support throughout a patient’s fertility journey. Oma’s mission is to make fertility care accessible through affordable/transparent pricing and its innovative technology.

 

Job Summary

Oma Fertility is seeking a Customer Success Manager to support a team of Care Advocates.

This role will help drive customer acquisition and retention, with the goal of maintaining high levels of customer satisfaction throughout their fertility journey.

 

Key responsibilities include working directly with company leaders, sales, finance, marketing, product, clinical team members and practice managers to understand the customer journey through key metrics. As the Customer Success Manager, you will be involved directly in the creation, implementation, use, and iteration of the processes to support the customers and the mission of Oma Fertility.  Identify gaps in processes that impact the success of our customers and collaborate with the teams needed to resolve those issues.

 

Required Qualifications

·       Bachelor’s degree

·       2+ years of professional experience in a Customer Success, Account Management, Project Management, or other relevant experiences, ideally in a high-growth, start-up environment

·       Enthusiasm for Oma Fertility’s mission

 

Preferred Qualifications

·       Experience with eIVF and Salesforce

·       Excellent computer knowledge, including proficiency in Word and Excel

·       Detail-oriented with strong analytical, writing, and communication skills

·       Comfortable working in a startup environment and wear multiple hats

·       Experience with developing best practices, creating scalable systems, and automating routine processes

·       Ability to adopt a continuous improvement mindset and actively contribute to the processes and procedures of the Customer Success team

·       Organized, diligent, and self-motivated

·       A proven ability to inspire, coach, and motivate a team and customers

To find out more: If you have this experience, are curious and intrigued but would like to learn more, please send your Linked-In profile or a brief overview of your experience and let’s schedule a 30-minute chat.

Our Company is an equal opportunity employer. Employment and processes, including decisions to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, are based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

Our Company requires those hired into this position to provide proof that they have received the COVID-19 vaccine. Any individuals subject to this requirement may submit for consideration a request to be exempted from the requirement (based on a valid religious or medical reason) on forms to be provided by Our Company. Such requests will be subject to review and approval by Our Company, and exemptions will be granted only if Our Company can provide a reasonable accommodation in relation to the requested exemption. Note that approvals for reasonable accommodations are reviewed and approved on a case-by-case basis and availability of a reasonable accommodation is not guaranteed. This vaccination requirement is based, in part, on recently established government requirements. The requirement is also based on the safety and effectiveness of the vaccine in protecting against COVID-19, and our shared responsibility for the health and safety of patients, colleagues, and community. Employment is also contingent upon successful completion of a background check.

jobs.title: Physician Liaison - St.Louis and Atlanta
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Oma Robotics we’re on a mission to make the possibilities enabled by single cell surgeries accessible to more people. We’re using AI and Robotics to automate these processes, ultimately improving outcomes for all patients. The first challenge we’re tackling is fertility. Oma Fertility is setting a new standard for fertility care by opening the first national brand of fertility clinics that provide a better experience enabled through AI and robotics-powered fertility technologies. Our tech will aim to increase In-Vitro Fertilization (IVF) success rates at significantly lower costs — providing greater accessibility to fertility care.

Physician & Community Liaison

Territory: St. Louis, MO and Atlanta, GA

Are you looking for a new opportunity in a fast growing market space, where innovation and forward thinking is rewarded, diversity is valued, and you make a difference in the lives of others?

At Oma Fertility, an Oma Robotics brand, we believe in a world in which everyone seeking to have a child can access successful fertility treatment. We’re on a mission to empower growing families with science forward, affordable treatment. We’ve created technology powered by AI that aims to lead to better pregnancy outcomes, built our labs to meet the most rigorous standards, designed a care approach that’s personalized and personable, and are committed to ethical pricing. 

This mission was the catalyst to secure financial backing to both develop the technology and open our own Oma Fertility clinics throughout the US. Recently named to Insider’s list of the 34 Most Promising Women’s Health Startups of 2022, this is a rare opportunity to join a team changing one of healthcare’s most important and human-centered services.

About the Role

We’re seeking a Physician & Community Liaison (PL) to join our Marketing team and play a key role in our growth and local market outreach in St. Louis, MO and Atlanta, GA. We aren’t putting the same old fertility experience behind a shiny new waiting room and that same mentality goes for this role and how we bring awareness to and develop a patient referral source network. Reporting to the Director, Clinical Marketing, this is an ideal opportunity for someone who isn’t afraid to break the norm and help forge a new path forward. This full-time role is a blend of sales, marketing, and educational activities and tactics and the ideal candidate will help define this role and set the foundation for Oma’s future growth. This person will be responsible for driving awareness of Oma Fertility in the local communities, building relationships with referral sources, and ultimately driving new patient visits. 

Responsibilities

  • Introduce Oma Fertility to potential referral sources including physicians/clinical staff, complimentary service providers, and community organizations via in person visits and other means 

  • Demonstrate we are at the forefront of the fertility space by highlighting what makes us different from other fertility clinics and by providing value and education to referral sources, their employees, and patrons

  • Help strategize and execute referral source sales/marketing plan to reach target audiences in designated territories by identifying opportunities, qualifying referral sources and receiving patient referrals

  • Create and maintain a territory action plan, inline with the sales/marketing plan, to maximize coverage of the territory and systematically identify new opportunities, maintain and build relationships, and proactively address any issues/declines in referrals

  • Overcome objections, build credibility and long-term relationships with referral sources while looking for ways to enhance the referral source experience

  • Coordinate Oma Fertility hosted events including: provider meetings, educational events, dinner presentations, tours, etc. to provide referral sources face-to-face interaction with our team

  • Represent Oma Fertility at local community events where our target audiences will be with the goal of creating awareness and reaching potential new patients

  • Help build and maintain our CRM database, track activities and opportunities, utilize dashboards & other reporting tools to plan and evaluate overall successes and areas in need of improvement

  • Support the development and growth of the sales/marketing team and plan with other miscellaneous tasks as needed to help drive new patient visits

Requirements

  • 3+ years of proven success in an outside sales role in the healthcare field, preferably in women’s health (technology experience/sales a plus)

  • Excellent interpersonal skills utilizing a consultative sales approach with the ability to communicate complex information in a manner that reflects the audience’s level of understanding

  • A self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced startup environment, can work independently and has strong time management skills to maximize effectiveness

  • Creative thinker who isn’t afraid to collaborate with internal teams, experiment, learn and incorporate new ideas into their role/strategies

  • Detail oriented with a willingness to use CRM on a daily basis to track all activities, monitor results, and make adjustments as needed

  • Represent Oma Fertility with the utmost professionalism, protecting patient confidentiality, following company policies/procedures and safeguarding confidential and proprietary information

  • Reliable transportation (in your home base market) as this is primarily an outside sales position with little time spent in the office

  • The ability to travel ~50% to other market(s) assigned to your territory (transportation needs/expenses covered by company), additional markets/territory realignments are possible dependent on company growth

  • Some nights and weekends will be required to accommodate specific events

  • BS/BA preferred, equivalent work experience

Benefits

  • Base salary + monthly/quarterly incentive based bonuses.

  • Full health benefits (medical, dental, vision, HSA) and 401k match program

  • Paid holidays, PTO, sick time, and parental leave

  • Company provided computer, smartphone and car allowance

  • Expense budget for travel and referral source outreach purchasing needs

About Oma Robotics & Oma Fertility

Oma Fertility, a division of Oma Robotics, was founded in 2020 by a team of engineers, AI experts, and fertility specialists who believe that combining AI and robotics in the lab and human-centered care in the clinic will make parenthood possible for more people. The company's first innovation is Oma Sperm InSight™, which uses AI to help pinpoint the most promising sperm cell for use in IVF. Oma Fertility opened its first fertility clinic in Santa Barbara, California, in 2021 and has plans to expand nationally through 2023. The company was founded in 2020 by Gurjeet Singh, PhD previous founder of Ayasdi, Dr. Sahil Gupta previous founder of Aveya Fertility, and Kiran Joshi, PhD previous founder of Koko. www.omafertility.com

To find out more: If you have this experience, are curious and intrigued but would like to learn more, please send your Linked-In profile or a brief overview of your experience and let’s schedule a 30-minute chat.

Our Company is an equal opportunity employer. Employment and processes, including decisions to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, are based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

Our Company requires those hired into this position to provide proof that they have received the COVID-19 vaccine. Any individuals subject to this requirement may submit for consideration a request to be exempted from the requirement (based on a valid religious or medical reason) on forms to be provided by Our Company. Such requests will be subject to review and approval by Our Company, and exemptions will be granted only if Our Company can provide a reasonable accommodation in relation to the requested exemption. Note that approvals for reasonable accommodations are reviewed and approved on a case-by-case basis and availability of a reasonable accommodation is not guaranteed. This vaccination requirement is based, in part, on recently established government requirements. The requirement is also based on the safety and effectiveness of the vaccine in protecting against COVID-19, and our shared responsibility for the health and safety of patients, colleagues, and community. Employment is also contingent upon successful completion of a background check.

 - Create and maintain a territory action plan, inline with the sales/marketing plan, to maximize coverage of the territory and systematically identify new opportunities, maintain and build relationships, and proactively address any issues/declines in referrals

 - Overcome objections, build credibility and long-term relationships with referral sources while looking for ways to enhance the referral source experience

 - Coordinate Oma Fertility hosted events including: provider meetings, educational events, dinner presentations, tours, etc. to provide referral sources face-to-face interaction with our team

 - Represent Oma Fertility at local community events where our target audiences will be with the goal of creating awareness and reaching potential new patients

 - Help build and maintain our CRM database, track activities and opportunities, utilize dashboards & other reporting tools to plan and evaluate overall successes and areas in need of improvement

 - Support the development and growth of the sales/marketing team and plan with other miscellaneous tasks as needed to help drive new patient visits


REQUIREMENTS

 - 3+ years of proven success in an outside sales role in the healthcare field, preferably in women’s health (technology experience/sales a plus)

 - Excellent interpersonal skills utilizing a consultative sales approach with the ability to communicate complex information in a manner that reflects the audience’s level of understanding

 - A self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced startup environment, can work independently and has strong time management skills to maximize effectiveness

 - Creative thinker who isn’t afraid to collaborate with internal teams, experiment, learn and incorporate new ideas into their role/strategies

 - Detail oriented with a willingness to use CRM on a daily basis to track all activities, monitor results, and make adjustments as needed

 - Represent Oma Fertility with the utmost professionalism, protecting patient confidentiality, following company policies/procedures and safeguarding confidential and proprietary information

 - Reliable transportation (in your home base market) as this is primarily an outside sales position with little time spent in the office

 - The ability to travel ~50% to other market(s) assigned to your territory (transportation needs/expenses covered by company), additional markets/territory realignments are possible dependent on company growth

 - Some nights and weekends will be required to accommodate specific events

 - BS/BA preferred, equivalent work experience


BENEFITS

 - Base salary + monthly/quarterly incentive based bonuses.

 - Full health benefits (medical, dental, vision, HSA) and 401k match program

 - Paid holidays, PTO, sick time, and parental leave

 - Company provided computer, smartphone and car allowance

 - Expense budget for travel and referral source outreach purchasing needs


ABOUT OMA ROBOTICS & OMA FERTILITY

Oma Fertility, a division of Oma Robotics, was founded in 2020 by a team of engineers, AI experts, and fertility specialists who believe that combining AI and robotics in the lab and human-centered care in the clinic will make parenthood possible for more people. The company's first innovation is Oma Sperm InSight™, which uses AI to help pinpoint the most promising sperm cell for use in IVF. Oma Fertility opened its first fertility clinic in Santa Barbara, California, in 2021 and has plans to expand nationally through 2023. The company was founded in 2020 by Gurjeet Singh, PhD previous founder of Ayasdi, Dr. Sahil Gupta previous founder of Aveya Fertility, and Kiran Joshi, PhD previous founder of Koko. www.omafertility.com http://www.omafertility.com

To find out more: If you have this experience, are curious and intrigued but would like to learn more, please send your Linked-In profile or a brief overview of your experience and let’s schedule a 30-minute chat.

Our Company is an equal opportunity employer. Employment and processes, including decisions to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, are based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

Our Company requires those hired into this position to provide proof that they have received the COVID-19 vaccine. Any individuals subject to this requirement may submit for consideration a request to be exempted from the requirement (based on a valid religious or medical reason) on forms to be provided by Our Company. Such requests will be subject to review and approval by Our Company, and exemptions will be granted only if Our Company can provide a reasonable accommodation in relation to the requested exemption. Note that approvals for reasonable accommodations are reviewed and approved on a case-by-case basis and availability of a reasonable accommodation is not guaranteed. This vaccination requirement is based, in part, on recently established government requirements. The requirement is also based on the safety and effectiveness of the vaccine in protecting against COVID-19, and our shared responsibility for the health and safety of patients, colleagues, and community. Employment is also contingent upon successful completion of a background check.

jobs.title: Physician Liaison
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Oma Robotics we’re on a mission to make the possibilities enabled by single cell surgeries accessible to more people. We’re using AI and Robotics to automate these processes, ultimately improving outcomes for all patients. The first challenge we’re tackling is fertility. Oma Fertility is setting a new standard for fertility care by opening the first national brand of fertility clinics that provide a better experience enabled through AI and robotics-powered fertility technologies. Our tech will aim to increase In-Vitro Fertilization (IVF) success rates at significantly lower costs — providing greater accessibility to fertility care.

Physician & Community Liaison

Territory: New York City and Long Island, NY

Are you looking for a new opportunity in a fast growing market space, where innovation and forward thinking is rewarded, diversity is valued, and you make a difference in the lives of others?

At Oma Fertility, an Oma Robotics brand, we believe in a world in which everyone seeking to have a child can access successful fertility treatment. We’re on a mission to empower growing families with science forward, affordable treatment. We’ve created technology powered by AI that aims to lead to better pregnancy outcomes, built our labs to meet the most rigorous standards, designed a care approach that’s personalized and personable, and are committed to ethical pricing. 

This mission was the catalyst to secure financial backing to both develop the technology and open our own Oma Fertility clinics throughout the US. Recently named to Insider’s list of the 34 Most Promising Women’s Health Startups of 2022, this is a rare opportunity to join a team changing one of healthcare’s most important and human-centered services.

About the Role

We’re seeking a Physician & Community Liaison (PL) to join our Marketing team and play a key role in our growth and local market outreach in St. Louis, MO and Atlanta, GA. We aren’t putting the same old fertility experience behind a shiny new waiting room and that same mentality goes for this role and how we bring awareness to and develop a patient referral source network. Reporting to the Director, Clinical Marketing, this is an ideal opportunity for someone who isn’t afraid to break the norm and help forge a new path forward. This full-time role is a blend of sales, marketing, and educational activities and tactics and the ideal candidate will help define this role and set the foundation for Oma’s future growth. This person will be responsible for driving awareness of Oma Fertility in the local communities, building relationships with referral sources, and ultimately driving new patient visits. 

Responsibilities

  • Introduce Oma Fertility to potential referral sources including physicians/clinical staff, complimentary service providers, and community organizations via in person visits and other means 

  • Demonstrate we are at the forefront of the fertility space by highlighting what makes us different from other fertility clinics and by providing value and education to referral sources, their employees, and patrons

  • Help strategize and execute referral source sales/marketing plan to reach target audiences in designated territories by identifying opportunities, qualifying referral sources and receiving patient referrals

  • Create and maintain a territory action plan, inline with the sales/marketing plan, to maximize coverage of the territory and systematically identify new opportunities, maintain and build relationships, and proactively address any issues/declines in referrals

  • Overcome objections, build credibility and long-term relationships with referral sources while looking for ways to enhance the referral source experience

  • Coordinate Oma Fertility hosted events including: provider meetings, educational events, dinner presentations, tours, etc. to provide referral sources face-to-face interaction with our team

  • Represent Oma Fertility at local community events where our target audiences will be with the goal of creating awareness and reaching potential new patients

  • Help build and maintain our CRM database, track activities and opportunities, utilize dashboards & other reporting tools to plan and evaluate overall successes and areas in need of improvement

  • Support the development and growth of the sales/marketing team and plan with other miscellaneous tasks as needed to help drive new patient visits

Requirements

  • 3+ years of proven success in an outside sales role in the healthcare field, preferably in women’s health (technology experience/sales a plus)

  • Excellent interpersonal skills utilizing a consultative sales approach with the ability to communicate complex information in a manner that reflects the audience’s level of understanding

  • A self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced startup environment, can work independently and has strong time management skills to maximize effectiveness

  • Creative thinker who isn’t afraid to collaborate with internal teams, experiment, learn and incorporate new ideas into their role/strategies

  • Detail oriented with a willingness to use CRM on a daily basis to track all activities, monitor results, and make adjustments as needed

  • Represent Oma Fertility with the utmost professionalism, protecting patient confidentiality, following company policies/procedures and safeguarding confidential and proprietary information

  • Reliable transportation (in your home base market) as this is primarily an outside sales position with little time spent in the office

  • The ability to travel ~50% to other market(s) assigned to your territory (transportation needs/expenses covered by company), additional markets/territory realignments are possible dependent on company growth

  • Some nights and weekends will be required to accommodate specific events

  • BS/BA preferred, equivalent work experience

Benefits

  • Base salary + monthly/quarterly incentive based bonuses.

  • Full health benefits (medical, dental, vision, HSA) and 401k match program

  • Paid holidays, PTO, sick time, and parental leave

  • Company provided computer, smartphone and car allowance

  • Expense budget for travel and referral source outreach purchasing needs

About Oma Robotics & Oma Fertility

Oma Fertility, a division of Oma Robotics, was founded in 2020 by a team of engineers, AI experts, and fertility specialists who believe that combining AI and robotics in the lab and human-centered care in the clinic will make parenthood possible for more people. The company's first innovation is Oma Sperm InSight™, which uses AI to help pinpoint the most promising sperm cell for use in IVF. Oma Fertility opened its first fertility clinic in Santa Barbara, California, in 2021 and has plans to expand nationally through 2023. The company was founded in 2020 by Gurjeet Singh, PhD previous founder of Ayasdi, Dr. Sahil Gupta previous founder of Aveya Fertility, and Kiran Joshi, PhD previous founder of Koko. www.omafertility.com

To find out more: If you have this experience, are curious and intrigued but would like to learn more, please send your Linked-In profile or a brief overview of your experience and let’s schedule a 30-minute chat.

Our Company is an equal opportunity employer. Employment and processes, including decisions to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, are based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

Our Company requires those hired into this position to provide proof that they have received the COVID-19 vaccine. Any individuals subject to this requirement may submit for consideration a request to be exempted from the requirement (based on a valid religious or medical reason) on forms to be provided by Our Company. Such requests will be subject to review and approval by Our Company, and exemptions will be granted only if Our Company can provide a reasonable accommodation in relation to the requested exemption. Note that approvals for reasonable accommodations are reviewed and approved on a case-by-case basis and availability of a reasonable accommodation is not guaranteed. This vaccination requirement is based, in part, on recently established government requirements. The requirement is also based on the safety and effectiveness of the vaccine in protecting against COVID-19, and our shared responsibility for the health and safety of patients, colleagues, and community. Employment is also contingent upon successful completion of a background check.
